original: de chom rkun gyi gtam gyi sbyor ba la'ang brtson par mi gnas so //
analyzed: de chom rkun gyi gtam gyi sbyor ba la'ang brtson par mi gnas so //
translated: He does not apply himself to the topic of thieves.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽'di ltar de ni rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong pa'i chos thams cad la /🔽chos gang la'ang bsdu ba'am /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na / 'di ltar de ni rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong pa'i chos thams cad la / chos gang la'ang bsdu ba'am /
translated: And why?

original: dbrog pa yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dbrog pa yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he does not see any phenomenon that could be added to or taken away from all phenomena that are empty of their own marks.

original: de dmag gi gtam gyi sbyor ba la'ang brtson par mi gnas so //
analyzed: de dmag gi gtam gyi sbyor ba la'ang brtson par mi gnas so //
translated: He does not apply himself to the topic of armies.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why?

original: 'di ltar de ni rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid la legs par gnas pas /🔽chos gang la'ang nyung du nyid du'am /
analyzed: 'di ltar de ni rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid la legs par gnas pas / chos gang la'ang nyung du nyid du'am /
translated: Because he is well established in the emptiness of inherent natures,

original: mang po nyid du yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mang po nyid du yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: and he does not see any phenomenon as being few or many.

original: de sangs rgyas kyi gtam gyi sbyor ba la'ang brtson par mi gnas so //
analyzed: de sangs rgyas kyi gtam gyi sbyor ba la'ang brtson par mi gnas so //
translated: He does not apply himself to the topic of the Buddha.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why?

original: 'di ltar chos thams cad kyi stong pa nyid la legs par gnas pas chos gang la'ang sogs pa yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar chos thams cad kyi stong pa nyid la legs par gnas pas chos gang la'ang sogs pa yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are well-established in the emptiness of all phenomena, they do not see any phenomenon as being included or not included.

original: de grong dang grong khyer dang grong rdal dang / rgyal po'i pho brang 'khor gyi gtam gyi sbyor ba la'ang brtson par mi gnas so //
analyzed: de grong dang grong khyer dang grong rdal dang / rgyal po'i pho brang 'khor gyi gtam gyi sbyor ba la'ang brtson par mi gnas so //
translated: They do not apply themselves to the topics of conversation of villages, towns, cities, and royal palaces.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽'di ltar de ni nam mkha' stong pa nyid la legs par gnas pas chos gang la'ang bsdu ba'am /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na / 'di ltar de ni nam mkha' stong pa nyid la legs par gnas pas chos gang la'ang bsdu ba'am /
translated: And why?

original: mi bsdu ba yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi bsdu ba yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are well-established in the emptiness of space, they do not see any phenomenon as being included or not included.

original: de dud 'gro'i gtam gyi sbyor ba la'ang brtson par mi gnas so //
analyzed: de dud 'gro'i gtam gyi sbyor ba la'ang brtson par mi gnas so //
translated: They do not apply themselves to the topics of conversation of animals.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽rab 'byor / 'di ltar de yang dag pa'i mtha' la legs par gnas pas chos thams cad la bsdu ba'am /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na / rab 'byor / 'di ltar de yang dag pa'i mtha' la legs par gnas pas chos thams cad la bsdu ba'am /
translated: And why?

original: mi bsdu ba yang dag @410a *//
analyzed: mi bsdu ba yang dag @410a *//
translated: Subhūti, because they are well-established in the limit of reality, they do not see any phenomenon as being included or not included.

original: par rjes su mi mthong zhing chos gang la'ang 'phal ba'am 'bri ba yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: par rjes su mi mthong zhing chos gang la'ang 'phal ba'am 'bri ba yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he does not see any dharma that increases or decreases.

original: de bdag dang / sems can dang / skye ba po dang / srog dang / shes pa po dang / mthong ba po'i bar gyi gtam gyi sbyor ba la brtson par mi gnas so //
analyzed: de bdag dang / sems can dang / skye ba po dang / srog dang / shes pa po dang / mthong ba po'i bar gyi gtam gyi sbyor ba la brtson par mi gnas so //
translated: He does not apply himself to the practice of talk about self, or talk about a sentient being, or talk about a life-force, or talk about an individual soul, up to or talk about one who sees.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why?

original: 'di ltar chos thams cad srog med pa dang / sems can med par yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar chos thams cad srog med pa dang / sems can med par yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he does not see any dharma that is without a life-force, or without a sentient being.

original: de sna tshogs kyi gtam gyi sbyor ba la'ang brtson par mi gnas so //
analyzed: de sna tshogs kyi gtam gyi sbyor ba la'ang brtson par mi gnas so //
translated: He does not apply himself to the practice of talk about variety.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why?

original: 'di ltar de shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la legs par gnas pas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i yid la byed pa dang nam yang mi 'bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar de shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la legs par gnas pas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i yid la byed pa dang nam yang mi 'bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he is never separated from the attention endowed with the knowledge of path aspects.

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod de; nam yang ser sna'i sbyor ba la brtson par mi gnas so //
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod de; nam yang ser sna'i sbyor ba la brtson par mi gnas so //
translated: He practices the perfection of generosity, but never remains fixed in the application of stinginess.

original: de bzhin du tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod de /
analyzed: de bzhin du tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod de /
translated: Similarly, he practices the perfection of moral discipline,

original: 'chal ba'i tshul khrims kyi sbyor ba la brtson par mi gnas so //
analyzed: 'chal ba'i tshul khrims kyi sbyor ba la brtson par mi gnas so //
translated: but never remains fixed in the application of immorality.

original: bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod de /
analyzed: bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod de /
translated: He practices the perfection of patience,

original: 'khrug pa dang khro ba'i sbyor ba la brtson par mi gnas so //
analyzed: 'khrug pa dang khro ba'i sbyor ba la brtson par mi gnas so //
translated: but never remains fixed in the application of anger and irritation.

original: brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod de /
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod de /
translated: He practices the perfection of perseverance,

original: le lo'i sbyor ba la brtson par mi gnas so //
analyzed: le lo'i sbyor ba la brtson par mi gnas so //
translated: but never remains fixed in the application of laziness.

original: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod de /
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod de /
translated: He practices the perfection of concentration,

original: rnam par g-yeng ba'i sbyor ba la brtson par mi gnas so //
analyzed: rnam par g-yeng ba'i sbyor ba la brtson par mi gnas so //
translated: but never remains fixed in the application of distraction.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la @410b spyod de /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la @410b spyod de /
translated: He practices the perfection of wisdom,

original: 'chal ba'i shes rab kyi sbyor ba la brtson par mi gnas so //
analyzed: 'chal ba'i shes rab kyi sbyor ba la brtson par mi gnas so //
translated: but never remains fixed in the application of false wisdom.

original: de chos thams cad stong pa nyid la spyod cing chos 'dod pa yin te /
analyzed: de chos thams cad stong pa nyid la spyod cing chos 'dod pa yin te /
translated: They practice the emptiness of all phenomena and long for the Dharma.

original: sems can rnams kyi don kyang byed do //
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi don kyang byed do //
translated: They also work for the welfare of sentient beings.

original: chos kyi dbyings la spyod cing /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings la spyod cing /
translated: They practice the realm of phenomena

original: chos tha dad pa'i bsngags pa brjod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: chos tha dad pa'i bsngags pa brjod pa ma yin no //
translated: and do not praise the Dharma as being different.

original: de sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams la bshes gnyen du 'dod pa yin te /
analyzed: de sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams la bshes gnyen du 'dod pa yin te /
translated: They consider the blessed buddhas and the bodhisattva great beings to be spiritual friends.

original: bshes gnyen du 'dod pa des chos thos nas nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa pa'i sems can gang dag yin pa de dag la chos de ston cing mos par byed do //
analyzed: bshes gnyen du 'dod pa des chos thos nas nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa pa'i sems can gang dag yin pa de dag la chos de ston cing mos par byed do //
translated: With that consideration of them as spiritual friends, they teach the Dharma to those sentient beings who are followers of the vehicles of the hearers and solitary buddhas, and inspire them.

original: chos de bstan cing mos par byas nas sems can de dag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug go /
analyzed: chos de bstan cing mos par byas nas sems can de dag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug go /
translated: Having taught the Dharma and inspired them, they cause those sentient beings to take up unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: 'dzud do // 'god do //
analyzed: 'dzud do // 'god do //
translated: They engage them in it and establish them in it.

original: de de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams la blta ba dang / mchod pa dang bsnyen bkur bya ba'i phyir 'jig rten gyi khams gang na bzhugs shing gzhes pa der skyes te /
analyzed: de de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams la blta ba dang / mchod pa dang bsnyen bkur bya ba'i phyir 'jig rten gyi khams gang na bzhugs shing gzhes pa der skyes te /
translated: They are born in the world systems where the tathāgatas, arhats, genuinely perfect buddhas are present, reside, and live, in order to behold them, to venerate them, to attend upon them, and to listen to the sacred doctrine from them.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas de dag mthong zhing /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas de dag mthong zhing / 'di lta ste /
translated: They behold those tathāgatas, arhats, genuinely perfect buddhas,🔽and they abide day and night

original: rdzogs pa'i byang chub yid la byed pa'i yid la byed pa de dag gis nyin mtshan du gnas so //🔽de ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽rab 'byor / 'di ltar phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams ni phal cher 'dod pa'i khams @411a *//
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i byang chub yid la byed pa'i yid la byed pa de dag gis nyin mtshan du gnas so // de ci'i phyir zhe na / rab 'byor / 'di ltar phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams ni phal cher 'dod pa'i khams @411a *//
translated: with those mental states that are directed toward perfect enlightenment.

original: dang ldan pa'i yid la bya ba dag bskyed nas /
analyzed: dang ldan pa'i yid la bya ba dag bskyed nas /
translated: If you ask why, Su­bhūti, it is because those irreversible great bodhisattva beings, for the most part, having generated mental states that are associated with the world system of desire,🔽abide by the ten virtuous actions,

original: dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam rnams la gnas te /
analyzed: dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam rnams la gnas te /
translated: and

original: gang na de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams mngon du gyur cing mthong ba'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing de dag tu smon lam gyi dbang gis skye ba dang / de bzhin du bsam gtan dang po bskyed cing /
analyzed: gang na de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams mngon du gyur cing mthong ba'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing de dag tu smon lam gyi dbang gis skye ba dang / de bzhin du bsam gtan dang po bskyed cing /
translated: Similarly, they generate the first concentration and

original: bsam gtan bzhi ba'i bar du bskyed nas smon lam gyi dbang gis sangs rgyas kyi zhing de dag tu skye'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi ba'i bar du bskyed nas smon lam gyi dbang gis sangs rgyas kyi zhing de dag tu skye'o //
translated: up to they generate the fourth concentration, and through the power of their prayers they are born in those buddhafields.

original: rab 'byor / rnam pa dang / rtags dang / mtshan ma de dag dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni phyir mi ldog par ston to //
analyzed: rab 'byor / rnam pa dang / rtags dang / mtshan ma de dag dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni phyir mi ldog par ston to //
translated: Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings endowed with those aspects, those signs, and those indications are shown to be irreversible.

original: rab 'byor / gzhan yang phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzhan yang phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod /
translated: “Furthermore, Subhūti, irreversible bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom

original: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa nas /
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa nas /
translated: practice the perfection of concentration,

original: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar la spyod //
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar la spyod //
translated: up to and practice the emptiness that is the nonexistence of an intrinsic nature.

original: dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams la spyod /
analyzed: dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams la spyod /
translated: They practice the applications of mindfulness,

original: de bzhin du sbyar te /🔽sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar la spyod pa de 'di snyam du bdag ni phyir mi ldog pa'am /
analyzed: de bzhin du sbyar te / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar la spyod pa de 'di snyam du bdag ni phyir mi ldog pa'am /
translated: and in the same vein,🔽up to and practice the eighteen distinct qualities of the buddhas.🔽They do not entertain any doubts whatsoever, thinking, ‘Am I irreversible,

original: phyir mi ldog pa ma yin no snyam du de the tshom rnam pa thams cad du mi skye'o //
analyzed: phyir mi ldog pa ma yin no snyam du de the tshom rnam pa thams cad du mi skye'o //
translated: or am I not irreversible?’

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: If you ask why,

original: de rang gi sa la the tshom med de /
analyzed: de rang gi sa la the tshom med de /
translated: it is because they have no doubts about their own level.

original: chos rnams shin tu yongs su shes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos rnams shin tu yongs su shes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they have thoroughly cognized all things.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽'di ltar de ni phyir mi ldog pa'am /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na / 'di ltar de ni phyir mi ldog pa'am /
translated: If you ask why,🔽it is because they do not consider even the most subtle of phenomena to be irreversible

original: phyir mi ldog pa ma yin @411b pa'i chos phra rab tsam yang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyir mi ldog pa ma yin @411b pa'i chos phra rab tsam yang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: or not to be irreversible.

original: rab 'byor / 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di lta ste /
translated: “Su­bhūti, it is because

original: dper na / rgyun du zhugs pa'i gang zag ni rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu de la som nyi med cing the tshom mi za'o //
analyzed: dper na / rgyun du zhugs pa'i gang zag ni rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu de la som nyi med cing the tshom mi za'o //
translated: For example, Subhūti, a person who has entered the stream has no doubts or uncertainties about the fruit of entering the stream.

original: rab 'byor / de bzhin du phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'ang phyir mi ldog pa'i sa de la som nyi med cing the tshom mi za'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor / de bzhin du phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'ang phyir mi ldog pa'i sa de la som nyi med cing the tshom mi za'o //
translated: In the same way, Subhūti, irreversible bodhisattva great beings have no doubts or uncertainties about the irreversible stage.

original: de phyir mi ldog pa'i sa de la gnas nas /
analyzed: de phyir mi ldog pa'i sa de la gnas nas /
translated: They, standing in that irreversible stage,

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yang yongs su dag par byed do //🔽sems can rnams yongs su smin par byed do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yang yongs su dag par byed do // sems can rnams yongs su smin par byed do //
translated: purify a buddhafield and bring beings to maturity.

original: bdud kyi las skyes shing byung ba dag kyang shes te /
analyzed: bdud kyi las skyes shing byung ba dag kyang shes te /
translated: They know the deeds of Māra that arise and appear,

original: bdud kyi las kyi dbang du'ang mi 'gro'o //
analyzed: bdud kyi las kyi dbang du'ang mi 'gro'o //
translated: and they do not fall under the power of the deeds of Māra.

original: bdud kyi las thams cad shes nas kyang rnam par 'joms so //
analyzed: bdud kyi las thams cad shes nas kyang rnam par 'joms so //
translated: Having known all the deeds of Māra, they destroy them,

original: rnam par 'thor ro //
analyzed: rnam par 'thor ro //
translated: they scatter them.

original: rab 'byor / 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di lta ste /
translated: Subhūti, it is like this:

original: dper na / mtshams med pa byed pa'i mi ni 'chi kha'i bar du'ang rtag tu mtshams med pa'i sems dang mi 'bral zhing /
analyzed: dper na / mtshams med pa byed pa'i mi ni 'chi kha'i bar du'ang rtag tu mtshams med pa'i sems dang mi 'bral zhing /
translated: For example, a person who has committed a heinous crime is never separated from the thought of the heinous crime until the moment of death.

original: de'i mtshams med pa'i sems de rjes su 'brang ste /
analyzed: de'i mtshams med pa'i sems de rjes su 'brang ste /
translated: That thought of the heinous crime follows him.

original: mtshams med pa'i sems de ni thabs thams cad kyis kyang gzhil bar mi nus shing /
analyzed: mtshams med pa'i sems de ni thabs thams cad kyis kyang gzhil bar mi nus shing /
translated: That thought of the heinous crime cannot be removed by any means whatsoever.

original: de'i kun nas ldang ba'i sems de ni 'chi kha'i bar du'ang rjes su 'brang ngo //
analyzed: de'i kun nas ldang ba'i sems de ni 'chi kha'i bar du'ang rjes su 'brang ngo //
translated: The thought of his agitation follows him until the moment of death.

original: rab 'byor / de bzhin du phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i phyir mi ldog pa'i sems de'ang phyir mi ldog pa'i sa la gnas par gyur nas mi g-yo ste /🔽lha dang mi dang lha ma yin du bcas pa'i 'jig rten gyis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i @412a *//
analyzed: rab 'byor / de bzhin du phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i phyir mi ldog pa'i sems de'ang phyir mi ldog pa'i sa la gnas par gyur nas mi g-yo ste / lha dang mi dang lha ma yin du bcas pa'i 'jig rten gyis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i @412a *//
translated: Subhūti, in the same way, the thought of irreversibility of a bodhisattva great being who is irreversible does not waver from the irreversible level.

original: byang chub las phyir zlog par mi nus so //
analyzed: byang chub las phyir zlog par mi nus so //
translated: The world with its gods, humans, and asuras cannot turn him away from unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ltar phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni lha dang mi dang lha ma yin du bcas pa'i 'jig rten las 'das nas yang dag pa nyid skyon med pa la zhugs te /🔽rang gi sa la gnas nas byang chub sems dpa'i mngon par shes pa rnams kyis dam pa'i pha rol tu phyin pas sangs rgyas kyi zhing yang yongs su dag par byed /
analyzed: 'di ltar phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni lha dang mi dang lha ma yin du bcas pa'i 'jig rten las 'das nas yang dag pa nyid skyon med pa la zhugs te / rang gi sa la gnas nas byang chub sems dpa'i mngon par shes pa rnams kyis dam pa'i pha rol tu phyin pas sangs rgyas kyi zhing yang yongs su dag par byed /
translated: In this way, irreversible bodhisattva great beings transcend the world with its gods, humans, and asuras, enter into the faultless state of reality,

original: sems can rnams kyang yongs su smin par byed de /
analyzed: sems can rnams kyang yongs su smin par byed de /
translated: and, abiding in their own stage, through the bodhisattva’s superknowledges, they purify the buddhafields and bring sentient beings to maturity.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das la blta ba dang / phyag bya ba dang / dam pa'i chos kyang mnyan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das la blta ba dang / phyag bya ba dang / dam pa'i chos kyang mnyan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to see the blessed buddhas, to pay homage to them, and to listen to the sublime Dharma,

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing nas sangs rgyas kyi zhing du 'gro ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing nas sangs rgyas kyi zhing du 'gro ste /
translated: they travel from buddhafield to buddhafield.

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing de dag tu sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das nyan thos kyi dge 'dun dang bcas pa rnams la dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams bskyed cing /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing de dag tu sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das nyan thos kyi dge 'dun dang bcas pa rnams la dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams bskyed cing /
translated: In those buddhafields, they plant roots of virtue with the blessed buddhas and their saṅgha of hearers.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag la yongs su 'dri bar byed /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag la yongs su 'dri bar byed /
translated: because they ask questions of those lord buddhas,

original: yongs su zhu bar byed /

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos chos thams cad la bslabs nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya zhing @418a *//

analyzed: mngon par zhen pa ma gtogs par 'di la chos gang ngo bo nyid kyis dmigs pa ni 'ga' yang med de /

analyzed: 'dir bdag gis chos rnams kyi ngo bo nyid la brtags nas chos gang yang ma dmigs na /

analyzed: ci'i phyir bdag chos rnams la mngon par zhen par bya snyam du brtag par bya'o //

analyzed: rab 'byor / de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po chos kyi ngo bo nyid la rtog na /
translated: “Subhūti, when bodhisattva great beings investigate the essence of phenomena in this way,

analyzed: yang na rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu'am /

analyzed: yang na dgra bcom pa nyid dam /

original: yang na rang byang chub bam /
analyzed: yang na rang byang chub bam /

original: yang na bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub bam /
analyzed: yang na bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub bam /
translated: or unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening,

original: chos gang la'ang mngon par zhen pa med do //
analyzed: chos gang la'ang mngon par zhen pa med do //
translated: he does not settle down on any dharma at all.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: If you ask why,

original: 'di ltar des chos thams cad ngo bo nyid kyis stong par mthong ste stong pa nyid ni stong pa nyid la mngon par zhen pa med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'di ltar des chos thams cad ngo bo nyid kyis stong par mthong ste stong pa nyid ni stong pa nyid la mngon par zhen pa med pa'i phyir te /

analyzed: stong pa nyid kyang dmigs su med @418b na; stong pa nyid la mngon par zhen pa lta smos kyang ci dgos te /

analyzed: rab 'byor / de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po chos thams cad la mngon par zhen pa med par gnas so //
translated: “Su­bhūti, great bodhisattva beings thus abide without settling down on any dharmas at all.

original: bslab pa gang la bslabs shing bslab pa gang la gnas nas /
analyzed: bslab pa gang la bslabs shing bslab pa gang la gnas nas /
translated: Having trained in which training, and having abided in which training,

original: sems can thams cad kyi spyod pa la rnam par lta bar byed de /
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi spyod pa la rnam par lta bar byed de /

analyzed: 'di dag gang la spyod ces bltas na yod pa ma yin pa la 'dzin pa la'o //
translated: When he observes, “In what are they engaged?” he sees that they are engaged in the apprehension of what does not exist.

original: yod pa ma yin pa la 'dzin pa la spyod pa'i sems can de dag mthong nas kyang de 'di snyam du sems te /🔽sems can 'di dag ni yod pa ma yin pa la 'dzin pa las dgrol sla ba dag go snyam nas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas shing /
analyzed: yod pa ma yin pa la 'dzin pa la spyod pa'i sems can de dag mthong nas kyang de 'di snyam du sems te / sems can 'di dag ni yod pa ma yin pa la 'dzin pa las dgrol sla ba dag go snyam nas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas shing /
translated: Having seen that those sentient beings are engaged in the apprehension of what does not exist, he thinks,🔽“These sentient beings are easy to liberate from the apprehension of what does not exist.”

original: thabs la mkhas pas sems can de dag yod pa ma yin pa la 'dzin pa de dang bral bar byed do //
analyzed: thabs la mkhas pas sems can de dag yod pa ma yin pa la 'dzin pa de dang bral bar byed do //
translated: Abiding in the perfection of wisdom, he, through skill in means, causes those sentient beings to be freed from the apprehension of what does not exist.

original: bral nas kyang chos drug la 'jug par byed de /
analyzed: bral nas kyang chos drug la 'jug par byed de /
translated: Having freed them, he causes them to engage in six dharmas.🔽He says, “Come, sentient beings, give gifts, so that you will not be separated from enjoyments.

original: 'di skad ces kye sems can dag sbyin pa dag byin cig dang / khyod longs spyod rnams dang bral bar mi 'gyur ro; ;longs spyod de dag gis kyang rlom sems su ma byed cig /
analyzed: 'di skad ces kye sems can dag sbyin pa dag byin cig dang / khyod longs spyod rnams dang bral bar mi 'gyur ro; ;longs spyod de dag gis kyang rlom sems su ma byed cig /
translated: But do not be proud of those enjoyments.

original: de la snying po cung zad kyang med do //
analyzed: de la snying po cung zad kyang med do //
translated: There is not the slightest essence in them.

original: de bzhin du tshul khrims srungs shig /
analyzed: de bzhin du tshul khrims srungs shig /
translated: In the same way, guard morality!

original: bzod pa sgrubs shig /
analyzed: bzod pa sgrubs shig /

original: de bzhin du brtson 'grus rtsoms shig /
analyzed: de bzhin du brtson 'grus rtsoms shig /

original: de bzhin du bsam gtan rnams la snyoms par zhugs shig /
analyzed: de bzhin du bsam gtan rnams la snyoms par zhugs shig /
translated: In the same way, enter into the meditative concentrations!

original: de bzhin du shes rab sgoms shig /
analyzed: de bzhin du shes rab sgoms shig /
translated: In the same way, cultivate wisdom!

analyzed: de dag gis rlom sems su'ang ma byed cig / de dag la @419a *//
translated: Do not be proud on account of them!

original: snying po cung zad kyang med do //
analyzed: snying po cung zad kyang med do //
translated: There is not the slightest essence in them.

original: de bzhin du rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la gnas par gyis shig /
analyzed: de bzhin du rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la gnas par gyis shig /
translated: In the same way, abide in the result of stream enterer!

original: des rlom sems su'ang ma byed cig /
analyzed: des rlom sems su'ang ma byed cig /
translated: Do not be proud on account of it!

original: de bzhin du dgra bcom pa nyid kyi bar la gnas par gyis shig /
analyzed: de bzhin du dgra bcom pa nyid kyi bar la gnas par gyis shig /
translated: In the same way, abide in the state of a worthy one!

analyzed: des rlom sems su'ang ma byed cig / de bzhin du rang byang chub la gnas par gyis shig /
translated: Do not be proud on account of it!🔽In the same way, abide in a pratyekabuddha’s awakening!

original: de bzhin du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la gnas par gyis shig /
analyzed: de bzhin du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la gnas par gyis shig /

analyzed: de bzhin du sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad la gnas par gyis shig /
translated: In the same way, you should abide in all the qualities of the Buddha.

original: de dag gis rlom sems su'ang ma byed cig /
analyzed: de dag gis rlom sems su'ang ma byed cig /
translated: But do not be conceited about them!

original: de dag la snying po cung zad kyang med do zhes ston te /
analyzed: de dag la snying po cung zad kyang med do zhes ston te /
translated: They are not worth a sixteenth part of the essence of the Dharma.

original: de sems can de dag la de skad 'doms /
analyzed: de sems can de dag la de skad 'doms /
translated: He teaches this to those sentient beings.

original: de skad rjes su ston cing de byang chub kyi lam la spyod de /
analyzed: de skad rjes su ston cing de byang chub kyi lam la spyod de /
translated: He instructs them in this way, and they practice the path to awakening.

original: chos gang la'ang mngon par zhen par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chos gang la'ang mngon par zhen par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: They do not settle down on any dharma.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why is that?

analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa nyid kyi phyir gang gis de dag mngon par zhen par 'gyur ba dang / gang du de dag mngon par zhen par 'gyur ba de dag gi ngo bo nyid med de /
translated: Because they are empty of an inherent nature, and that which they would settle down on, and that in which they would settle down, do not exist.

original: chos thams cad la mngon par zhen pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos thams cad la mngon par zhen pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they do not settle down on any dharma.

original: de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi lam la spyod cing /
analyzed: de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi lam la spyod cing /
translated: In this way, bodhisattva great beings practice the path to complete awakening.

original: chos gang la'ang mi gnas pa ste /
analyzed: chos gang la'ang mi gnas pa ste /
translated: They do not settle down on any dharma.

original: de'ang gnas pa med pa'i tshul gyis gnas so //
analyzed: de'ang gnas pa med pa'i tshul gyis gnas so //
translated: And that is so because it is not a matter of abiding.

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod de /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod de /
translated: He practices the perfection of generosity,

original: de la'ang mi gnas so //
analyzed: de la'ang mi gnas so //
translated: but he does not abide in that.

original: @419b de bzhin du tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod de /

translated: Similarly, he practices the perfection of moral discipline, the perfection of patient acceptance, the perfection of perseverance, the perfection of meditative concentration, and the perfection of wisdom,

original: de la'ang mi gnas so //
analyzed: de la'ang mi gnas so //
translated: but he does not abide in those.

original: de bsam gtan dang po la snyoms par 'jug ste /
analyzed: de bsam gtan dang po la snyoms par 'jug ste /

original: de la'ang mi gnas so //
analyzed: de la'ang mi gnas so //
translated: but he does not abide in that.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /

analyzed: 'di ltar bsam gtan ni ngo bo nyid kyis stong la gang snyoms par 'jug pa de'ang stong zhing /

analyzed: de bzhin du byams pa dang / snying rje dang / dga' ba dang / btang snyoms la'ang snyoms par 'jug ste /
translated: Similarly, they enter the meditative absorption of loving kindness, compassion, joy, and equanimity,

original: de dag la'ang mi gnas so //
analyzed: de dag la'ang mi gnas so //
translated: but they do not remain in them.

analyzed: de bzhin du gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu la'ang snyoms par 'jug ste /

original: de dag la'ang mi gnas so //
analyzed: de dag la'ang mi gnas so //

translated: but they do not remain in it.

analyzed: dgra bcom pa nyid kyi bar du'ang 'thob ste /

original: de la'ang mi gnas so //
analyzed: de la'ang mi gnas so //
translated: but they do not remain in it.

original: de bzhin du rang byang chub kyang 'thob ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du rang byang chub kyang 'thob ste /
translated: Similarly, they attain individual enlightenment,

original: de la'ang mi gnas so //
analyzed: de la'ang mi gnas so //
translated: but they do not remain in it.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why is that?

original: rnam pa gnyis kyi phyir te /🔽'bras bu de dag ngo bo nyid kyis med pa dang / de gang la gnas pa de tsam gyi chog par 'dzin @420a *//
analyzed: rnam pa gnyis kyi phyir te / 'bras bu de dag ngo bo nyid kyis med pa dang / de gang la gnas pa de tsam gyi chog par 'dzin @420a *//
translated: It is because of two things:

original: par mi byed pa'o //
analyzed: par mi byed pa'o //
translated: those fruits are essentially nonexistent, and they do not settle for just that much in terms of what they are to remain in.

original: de 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: de 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: He thinks like this:

analyzed: bdag gis rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu 'thob par mi bya /

analyzed: bdag gis de la gnas par mi bya'o //

original: de bzhin du rang sangs rgyas kyi sa'i bar la gnas par mi bya'o snyam mo //
analyzed: de bzhin du rang sangs rgyas kyi sa'i bar la gnas par mi bya'o snyam mo //
translated: Similarly, I should not stand in the stage of a pratyekabuddha.”

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ltar de 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: 'di ltar de 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: It is because he thinks like this:

analyzed: bdag ni the tshom med par bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya'o //

original: chos de dag kyang 'di nyid la yod do snyam du sems pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos de dag kyang 'di nyid la yod do snyam du sems pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Those dharmas are right here.”

original: de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po des sems dang po bskyed phyin chad /
analyzed: de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po des sems dang po bskyed phyin chad /
translated: Thus, that bodhisattva great being, from the first production of the thought of awakening onward,

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi sems ma gtogs par nam yang sems gang yang rung ba ma bskyed do //
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi sems ma gtogs par nam yang sems gang yang rung ba ma bskyed do //
translated: has never produced any other thought than the thought of unsurpassed, perfect buddhahood.

original: sa dang po nas bzung ste /
analyzed: sa dang po nas bzung ste /
translated: From the first ground up to

original: sa bcu pa'i bar du'ang de bzhin te /
analyzed: sa bcu pa'i bar du'ang de bzhin te /

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi sems 'ba' zhig go /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi sems 'ba' zhig go /

analyzed: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnam par mi g-yeng ba'i yid kyis lus sam /
translated: Subhūti, when bodhisattva-mahāsattvas, with undistracted minds,

analyzed: byang chub kyi sems de nyid la gnas nas byang chub kyi lam la rnam par g-yeng ba mi skyed do // de nas bcom ldan 'das la /
translated: Abiding in that very mind of enlightenment, they do not give rise to distraction on the path to enlightenment.

analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then the Blessed One said to the venerable Subhūti:

analyzed: btsun pa bcom ldan 'das @420b gal te chos thams cad ma skyes pa lags na /
translated: Subhūti, if all phenomena are unborn,

original: btsun pa bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: btsun pa bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Venerable Blessed One,

analyzed: ci lam skyes pas byang chub 'thob lags sam /
translated: is enlightenment attained through a born path?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /

original: rab 'byor / de ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ni ma yin no //

analyzed: gsol pa / ci lam ma skyes pas byang chub 'thob lags sam /
translated: He asked, “Is enlightenment attained by a path that is not produced?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One replied,

original: rab 'byor / de ni ma yin no //🔽gsol pa / 'o na ci lam skyes pa'ang ma lags /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ni ma yin no // gsol pa / 'o na ci lam skyes pa'ang ma lags /
translated: “No, Subhūti, it is not.”🔽He asked, “Well then, is enlightenment attained by a path that is produced,

original: ma skyes pa'ang ma lags pas byang chub 'thob lags sam /
analyzed: ma skyes pa'ang ma lags pas byang chub 'thob lags sam /
translated: or by a path that is not produced?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One replied,

original: rab 'byor / de ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ni ma yin no //
translated: “No, Subhūti, it is not.”

original: gsol pa / btsun pa bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / btsun pa bcom ldan 'das /

analyzed: grangs med / bsam gyis mi khyab / mtshungs pa med pa dag gis chos mngon par rtogs par gyur pa 'di ni 'jig rten du sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba gnyis pa yin no zhes de lta bu'i sgra de sangs rgyas kyi zhing de dag thams cad kyi 'khor

analyzed: sems can gyi ris na sems can gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo bshad pa 'di la dad pa mi bskyed cing /

analyzed: dang ba dang / lhag pa'i bsam pas mos pa mi skyed la /

analyzed: lus dang sems kyis tshogs pa sbyin par mi byed cing /

analyzed: da ltar yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di 'chad pa na 'gro bar byed cing /

analyzed: lus dang sems kyis kyang tshogs pa sbyin par mi byed de / shes rab 'chal par 'gyur ba'i las gsog par byed do //

original: phongs par 'gyur ba'i las gsog go /
analyzed: phongs par 'gyur ba'i las gsog go /

translated: By committing and accumulating the karma of being deprived of Dharma, they will burn in the hells for many hundreds of years, many thousands of years, many hundreds of thousands of years, many millions of billions of years.

original: de sems can dmyal ba chen por 'gro bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de sems can dmyal ba chen por 'gro bar 'gyur ro //

original: mes 'jig pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mes 'jig pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro //

analyzed: mes 'jig pa byung nas kyang 'jig rten gyi khams gzhan dag tu sems can dmyal ba chen por 'byung bar 'gyur te /

original: der skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: der skye bar 'gyur ro //

original: der yang lo brgya phrag mang po dang / lo stong phrag mang po dang / lo 'bum phrag mang po dang / lo bye ba khrag khrig 'bum phrag mang por bsreg par 'gyur te /
analyzed: der yang lo brgya phrag mang po dang / lo stong phrag mang po dang / lo 'bum phrag mang po dang / lo bye ba khrag khrig 'bum phrag mang por bsreg par 'gyur te /
translated: And there they will be burned for many hundreds of years, many thousands of years, many hundreds of thousands of years, many millions of years.

original: sems can dmyal ba chen po de nas kyang sems can dmyal ba chen por 'gro bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: sems can dmyal ba chen po de nas kyang sems can dmyal ba chen por 'gro bar 'gyur te /

analyzed: der song nas kyang yang mes 'jig pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro //

analyzed: der yang lo bye ba khrag khrig 'bum phrag mang po'i bar du bsreg par 'gyur ro //
translated: And there they will be burned for many millions of years.

original: sems can dmyal ba chen po de nas kyang sems can dmyal ba chen por 'gro bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: sems can dmyal ba chen po de nas kyang sems can dmyal ba chen por 'gro bar 'gyur te /

translated: When the great conflagration occurs, the wind of karma will blow them to the east, and they will be blown to the other directions as well.

analyzed: de nas der skyes nas sems can dmyal ba chen po nas sems can dmyal ba chen por 'gro bar 'gyur ro //

original: der yang mes 'jig pa 'byung bar 'gyur te /

original: mes 'jig pa byung nas de nas kyang shi 'phos te /
analyzed: mes 'jig pa byung nas de nas kyang shi 'phos te /

analyzed: chos kyis phongs par 'gyur ba'i las byas shing bsags pa des yang skye bar 'gyur zhing /

analyzed: yang sems can dmyal ba chen po nas sems can dmyal ba chen por 'gro bar 'gyur te /

analyzed: ji srid du mes 'jig pa 'byung ba de srid du sems can dmyal ba pa'i sdug bsngal myong bar 'gyur ro //

translated: When the conflagration occurs, they will die and be reborn in this world system.🔽They will be reborn in the animal realms of all the worlds in the ten directions.

analyzed: te; de der skyes nas kyang lo bye ba khrag khrig 'bum phrag mang por gshin rje'i 'jig rten pa'i sdug bsngal myong bar 'gyur ro //

analyzed: der gshin rje'i 'jig rten pa'i sdug bsngal zad par byas nas / 'di lta ste / dmus long gi khyim rnams su'am /

analyzed: gdol ba'i khyim rnams su'am / g-yung po'i khyim rnams su mi dang skal ba mnyam par skye bar 'gyur ro //

analyzed: der skyes nas kyang long ba'am /

analyzed: zhar ba'am / sgur po'am /

analyzed: lce med pa'am / lag pa med pa'am /

analyzed: rkang pa med pa'am / rna ba med pa'am / mdze can nam /
translated: lame,🔽deaf,🔽leprose,

analyzed: sha bkra can nam /
translated: or have white spots on his skin,

original: yan lag ma tshang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yan lag ma tshang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: and will have incomplete faculties.

original: 'jig rten gyi khams gang na sangs rgyas kyi sgra mi grag pa dang / chos kyi sgra mi grag pa dang / dge 'dun gyi sgra mi grag par 'gyur ba der rtag tu skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams gang na sangs rgyas kyi sgra mi grag pa dang / chos kyi sgra mi grag pa dang / dge 'dun gyi sgra mi grag par 'gyur ba der rtag tu skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: He will always be born in worlds where the sound of the Buddha, the sound of the Dharma, and the sound of the Saṅgha are absent.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

translated: Because he has created and accumulated the karma that leads to the loss of the Dharma, and he has fully completed the results of his actions.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bos 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bos 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then the venerable Ānanda said to the Blessed One,

original: btsun pa bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: btsun pa bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Respected Blessed One,

analyzed: mtshams ma mchis pa ni lnga lags la /
translated: there are five heinous acts,

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /

original: chos kyi phongs par 'gyur ba'i las bgyis shing bsags pa 'di ni drug par gyur pa lags so //
analyzed: chos kyi phongs par 'gyur ba'i las bgyis shing bsags pa 'di ni drug par gyur pa lags so //
translated: This is the sixth.”

original: bcom @434b ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom @434b ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: kun dga' bo /
analyzed: kun dga' bo /
translated: “Ānanda,

analyzed: gang zag de ni mchog tu gyur pa zhes mi bya yi /
translated: that person is not called supreme.

original: shin tu smad pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: shin tu smad pa zhes bya'o //

original: gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di 'chad cing ston pa na /
analyzed: gang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo 'di 'chad cing ston pa na /

analyzed: 'di ni ston pa'i bstan pa ma yin /

original: 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa ma yin gyi /

analyzed: khyed dang bdag cag gis de la bslab par mi bya'o zhes kyang zer zhing /

original: sems can mang po dag kyang de las 'byed par byed de /
analyzed: sems can mang po dag kyang de las 'byed par byed de /

original: de rang gi sems kyi rgyud la'ang gnod par byed de /
analyzed: de rang gi sems kyi rgyud la'ang gnod par byed de /

original: gzhan gyi sems kyi rgyud la'ang gnod par bya bar sems te /
analyzed: gzhan gyi sems kyi rgyud la'ang gnod par bya bar sems te /
translated: and they intend to harm the mental continuum of others.

original: de rang gi sems kyi rgyud kyang dug can du byas nas /
analyzed: de rang gi sems kyi rgyud kyang dug can du byas nas /
translated: Having poisoned their own mental continuum,

original: gzhan gyi sems kyi rgyud kyang dug can du bya bar sems te /
analyzed: gzhan gyi sems kyi rgyud kyang dug can du bya bar sems te /
translated: they intend to poison the mental continuum of others.

analyzed: bdag nyid kyang mtho ris dang thar pa'i bde ba las nyams par gyur la /
translated: They themselves will fall from the happiness of the higher realms and liberation.

analyzed: gzhan dag kyang mtho ris dang thar pa'i lam dag las nyams par bya bar sems /
